sen.j: 清原真衡（きよはら の さねひら、？ - 永保3年（1083年））は、平安時代後期の武将。
sen.e: KIYOHARA no Sanehira (? - 1083) was a Busho (Japanese military commander) in the late Heian period.
KIYOHARA no Sanehira (? - 1083) was a Busho (Japanese military commander) in the late Heian period.
KIYOHARA no Sanehira (year of birth unknown - 1083) was a Busho (Japanese military commander) who lived during the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、？をyear of birth unknownにしました。

sen.j: 奥州の豪族 清原武貞の子。
sen.e: He was a child of KIYOHARA no Takesada, Gozoku (local ruling family) of Oshu (Northern Honshu, the region encompassing Mutsu and Dewa provinces).
He was a child of KIYOHARA no Takesada, Gozoku (local ruling family) of Oshu (Northern Honshu, the region encompassing Mutsu and Dewa provinces).

sen.j: 延久年間に行われた延久蝦夷合戦などで活躍し鎮守府将軍従五位下であったとの史料がある清原貞衡と同一人物であるとの有力説がある。
sen.e: There is an influential theory that he was the same person as KIYOHARA no Sadahira on whom historical materials indicate that he was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the Chinju-fu shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North) and actively engaged in the Battle of Enkyu against the Ezo (Japanese northerners) which occurred in the Enkyu era (1069-1074).
sen.cmt: 「延久年間」は、広辞苑を参照しました。
sen.e: There is an influential theory that he was the same person as KIYOHARA no Sadahira, on whom historical materials indicate that he was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the Chinju-fu shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North) and actively engaged in the Battle of Enkyu against the Ezo (Japanese northerners) and other battles which occurred in the Enkyu era (1069-1074).
sen.cmt: KINOHARA no Sadahiraと１ が固有名詞のため、カンマを加え非制限用法の関係詞にしました。「延久蝦夷合戦など」のなど、の意味を加えました。
sen.e: There is an influential theory that he was the same person as KIYOHARA no Sadahira, on whom historical materials indicate that he was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the Chinju-fu shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North) and actively engaged in the Battle of Enkyu against the Ezo (Japanese northerners) and other battles which occurred in the Enkyu era (1069-1074).

sen.j: 武貞の死後出羽清原氏を嗣ぎ、出羽国の国司であった平氏の一門、平安忠の次男と言われる清原成衡を養子に迎えた。
sen.e: After the death of Takesada, he succeeded to the head of the Dewa Kiyohara clan and adopted KIYOHARA no Narihira, the alleged second son of TAIRA no Yasutada, a family of the Taira clan, who was the Kokushi (provincial governor) of Dewa Province.

sen.j: その成衡に源氏棟梁である源頼義の娘を嫁がせることで清原氏の家格を高めようとしたとも考えられている。
sen.e: He is thought to have attempted to raise the family status of the Kiyohara clan by getting Narihira married with a daughter of MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi, the Toryo (leader) of the Minamoto clan.

sen.j: しかし、こうした一連の政略結婚政策を遂行する中で棟梁としての権力を強化し、一族の家人化を進めた。
sen.e: However, while he carried out his policy of a series of marriages for political reason, he expanded his authority as Toryo (leader) and tried to make the family his Kenin (retainers).
However, while he carried out his policy of serial marriages of expediency, he expanded his authority as Toryo (leader) and promoted the subordination of the other families of the Kiyohara clan.
sen.cmt: policy やofが重複するのでa series ofを serialに、 marriages for political reasonを marriages of expendiencyにしました。「一族の家人化を進める」進める→promote、家人化→subordinationに変えました。
sen.e: However, while he carried out these series of political marriages, he expanded his authority as Toryo (leader) and promoted the subordination of the other families to the Kiyohara clan.
sen.cmt: 表現を変えました。 subordination... of→subordination... Toにしました。

sen.j: そのため、叔父吉彦秀武や弟藤原清衡、清原家衡の離反を招いた。
sen.e: That caused his uncle, KIMIKO-no-Hidetake, his younger brothers, FUJIWARA no Kiyohira and KIYOHARA no Iehira to break away from him.

sen.j: これが1083年（永保3年）に始まる後三年の役の背景である。
sen.e: The above is a background of the Gosannen no Eki (the Later Three Years' War) which started in 1083.

sen.j: 後三年の役の発端は、以下のとおりである。
sen.e: The origin of the Gosannen no Eki is described below.

sen.j: 成衡の婚礼のために出羽より陸奥国に参上した秀武が、祝いの品である砂金を頭上に掲げて控えていた。
sen.e: Hidetake visited Mutsu Province from Dewa Province to attend the marriage ceremony for Narihira and was waiting to see Sanehira holding a gift of Sakin (gold dust) above his head.

sen.j: にもかかわらず、奈良法師との囲碁に夢中になっていた真衡が、それを忘れて長時間待たせてしまったことにある。
sen.e: Nevertheless, Sanehira forgot the Hidetake's visit being immersed in the game of go with a Nara Hoshi (Buddhist priest from Nara) and ended up keeping Hidetake waiting for a long time.

sen.j: 屈辱を受けた秀武は大いに怒り、砂金をぶちまけて出羽に無断で帰ってしまった。
sen.e: Humiliated Hidetake threw out the Sakin in a fury and went back to Dewa unannounced.

sen.j: これに怒った真衡は直ちに秀武討伐の軍を起こして出羽に向かった。
sen.e: Sanehira got angry with that conduct, organized a troop to attack Hidetake and left for Dewa.

sen.j: 一方、秀武は自らと同じく日ごろから真衡に不満を持っていた真衡の異母弟の家衡・異父異母弟（家衡の母の連れ子）の清衡に挙兵を促して、真衡の背後を突かせようとした。
sen.e: On the other hand, Hidetake attempted to attack Sanehira from behind by urging troops to be raised byIehira, younger paternal brother of Sanehira and Kiyohira, younger stepbrother (a child by a previous marriage of Iehira's mother) of Sanehira, who had always been displeased with Sanehira as Hidetake himself had.

sen.j: 家衡・清衡は兵を挙げて真衡の館に迫ったが、それを知った真衡が軍を返して家衡・清衡を討とうとすると、彼らは本拠に退いた。
sen.e: The troops of Iehira and Kiyohira closed in on the residence of Sanehira, but Sanehira came to know it and tried to counterattack Iehira and kiyohira, who withdrew to their bases.

sen.j: その年の秋に、新たな陸奥守として源義家が下ってくると、真衡は義家に対して三日厨と呼ばれる三日間に渡る歓待を国府で行った。
sen.e: In fall of the same year, MINAMOTO no Yoshiie came down to the province to fill the position of Mutsu no kami (the governor of Mutsu Province), then Sanehira gave Yoshiie a warm reception for three days called Mikkakuriya in the Kokufu (ancient provincial capital).

sen.e: After then, Sanehira again went to the front to attack Hidetake, however, suddenly died from a disease on the way to the front.
